question: Why did Capa travel to Los Angeles?
answers: To restart his life after a patient commits suicide in front of him
He needed to restart his life.

question: Besides Capa, who else do the police consider in the murder of Dr. Moore?
answers: Moore's patients who gather together every Monday.

question: What type of disorder causes one of the patients to count things and insist everything is clean?
How did Sondra kill her father?
answers: She stabbed him with a knife and fork

question: How old is Richie, the transgender wishing to transform from a male to a female?
Why did Dale kill members of the therapy group?
answers: He was scared they were going to associate Rose to Richie
So they couldn't link Rose to Richie.

question: Why did Capa stop seeing the color red?
answers: He suffered from psychosomatic color blindness due to seeing his patient murdered
he saw the bloody body of his patient in a bright green dress

question: What type of art does Casey paint?
What did child psychiatrist, Niedelmeyer, do to Dale?
answers: He molested Dale as a child

question: How many patients committed crimes against their fathers?
How many patients' spouses are dead?
Which of Dale's siblings is dead?
What happened to Bill after the women in the green dress died?
answers: He can't see the color red anymore.
He lost his ability to see the color red

question: When did Capa lead group sessions?
Who abused Rose?
When did Rose end up in therapy?
answers: When Richie was arrested for drug possession

question: Which sibling saves Capa?
Which sibling does Capa Save?
Who wonders if Bill is a criminal?
What causes Dr. Bill Capa to become depressed?
answers: An unstable patient committed suicide in front of him by jumping out of the window.
A patient commits suicide in front of him

question: What did the sight of his patient that committed suicide cause?
answers: It caused color blindness to Dr. Capa and he can longer see the color red.

question: Why does Dr. Capa travel to Los Angeles?
answers: To restart his life and stay with his friend Dr. Bob Moore.

question: Who does the detective consider to be suspects of Dr. Moore's death?
answers: All of Dr. Moore's patients and even Dr. Capa himself.

question: How many of the patients have been involved, romantically, with Rose?
answers: All of the patients except for one.

question: What is the twist involving Richie?
Who committed all of the murders?
Why did Dale force Rose to play a role as their brother Richie?
answers: Dale was unable to accept that Richie was molested and committed suicide.
To help cope with Ritchie's death

question: Why did Dale kill anybody that had a relationship with Bonnie?
answers: In fear that they would connect Rose to Richie.
Figured they would figure out who Richie was

question: What prevents Dale from killing Dr. Capa?
answers: Dale is about to kill Dr. Capa when he is stopped and killed by Rose.
